question: Do paragraph kernel profile sequences follow section-specific patterns?

method.description: Classify each paragraph by kernel profile (HIGH_K, HIGH_E, BALANCED) using tertile thresholds on k-class and e-class MIDDLE proportions. Build paragraph-to-paragraph transition matrices per section. Test section-specificity via chi-square and entropy analysis with permutation null.

kernel_class_rules.k_class: MIDDLE contains 'k' (k, ck, kch, ke, ked, kee, ek, etc.)
kernel_class_rules.e_class: MIDDLE starts with 'e' (e, ed, edy, eo, eol, etc.)
kernel_class_rules.h_class: MIDDLE is 'h' or starts with 'h' (not ch-initial) -- too sparse for tertile, merged into BALANCED

B.sequence: BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED
BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED
HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED

C.sequence: HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED
BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED
BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED

S.sequence: BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED
HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_K
HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_K -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E

T.sequence: BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_K -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E
HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E -> HIGH_E -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> BALANCED -> HIGH_E

verdict_detail: Section-specific paragraph ordering confirmed via entropy analysis. Entropy permutation p = 0.0040 (< 0.01): observed mean entropy (2.5814 bits) is significantly lower than null (2.6286 bits). Entropy range across sections: 1.4724 bits (lowest: section T at 1.3201, highest: section S at 2.7925). Chi-square permutation p = 0.2330 (transition distributions overlap across sections, but ordering stereotypy differs).
